newsitem.title: FRANCE: French court to rule on Papon war crimes trial.
newsitem.headline: French court to rule on Papon war crimes trial.

text.p: A court will rule on September 18 whether an ex-minister should stand trial for crimes against humanity for deporting thousands of Jews from wartime France, justice sources said on Thursday.

Maurice Papon, budget minister in the 1970s before his wartime actions were known, is accused of deporting 1,690 Jews, including 223 children, in 1942-44 when he was secretary-general of the Bordeaux area administration. Most were later gassed at the Nazi Auschwitz death camp.
The decision will be handed down by an appeals court which held hearings in the southwestern city of Bordeaux in March on whether Papon, now 85, should face trial.
Papon's lawyer told reporters after the four-day March hearing he was convinced the court would decide in favour of his client and rule out a trial.
He said Papon had never followed Nazi ideology and had only obeyed orders imposed by the occupying power.
Whatever decision is handed down is likely to be appealed by the losing side, again delaying any conclusion to legal action initiated in 1981, legal sources said.
